00036  * libcfs/include/libcfs/linux/linux-time.h
00037  *
00038  * Implementation of portable time API for Linux (kernel and user-level).
00039  *
00040  * Author: Nikita Danilov <nikita@clusterfs.com>

00042 
00043 #ifndef __LIBCFS_LINUX_LINUX_TIME_H__
00044 #define __LIBCFS_LINUX_LINUX_TIME_H__
00045 
00046 #ifndef __LIBCFS_LIBCFS_H__
00047 #error Do not #include this file directly. #include <libcfs/libcfs.h> instead
00048 #endif
00049 
00050 #ifndef __KERNEL__
00051 #error This include is only for kernel use.
00052 #endif
00053 
00054 /* Portable time API */
00055 
00056 /*
00057  * Platform provides three opaque data-types:
00058  *
00059  *  cfs_time_t        represents point in time. This is internal kernel
00060  *                    time rather than "wall clock". This time bears no
00061  *                    relation to gettimeofday().
00062  *
00063  *  cfs_duration_t    represents time interval with resolution of internal
00064  *                    platform clock
00065  *
00066  *  cfs_fs_time_t     represents instance in world-visible time. This is
00067  *                    used in file-system time-stamps
00068  *
00069  *  cfs_time_t     cfs_time_current(void);
00070  *  cfs_time_t     cfs_time_add    (cfs_time_t, cfs_duration_t);
00071  *  cfs_duration_t cfs_time_sub    (cfs_time_t, cfs_time_t);
00072  *  int            cfs_impl_time_before (cfs_time_t, cfs_time_t);
00073  *  int            cfs_impl_time_before_eq(cfs_time_t, cfs_time_t);
00074  *
00075  *  cfs_duration_t cfs_duration_build(int64_t);
00076  *
00077  *  time_t         cfs_duration_sec (cfs_duration_t);
00078  *  void           cfs_duration_usec(cfs_duration_t, struct timeval *);
00079  *  void           cfs_duration_nsec(cfs_duration_t, struct timespec *);
00080  *
00081  *  void           cfs_fs_time_current(cfs_fs_time_t *);
00082  *  time_t         cfs_fs_time_sec    (cfs_fs_time_t *);
00083  *  void           cfs_fs_time_usec   (cfs_fs_time_t *, struct timeval *);
00084  *  void           cfs_fs_time_nsec   (cfs_fs_time_t *, struct timespec *);
00085  *  int            cfs_fs_time_before (cfs_fs_time_t *, cfs_fs_time_t *);
00086  *  int            cfs_fs_time_beforeq(cfs_fs_time_t *, cfs_fs_time_t *);
00087  *
00088  *  CFS_TIME_FORMAT
00089  *  CFS_DURATION_FORMAT
00090  *
00091  */
00092 
00093 #define ONE_BILLION ((u_int64_t)1000000000)
00094 #define ONE_MILLION 1000000
00095 
00096 #ifndef __KERNEL__
00097 #error This include is only for kernel use.
00098 #endif
00099 
00100 #include <linux/module.h>
00101 #include <linux/kernel.h>
00102 #include <linux/version.h>
00103 #include <linux/time.h>
00104 #include <asm/div64.h>
00105 
00106 /*
00107  * post 2.5 kernels.
00108  */
00109 
00110 #include <linux/jiffies.h>
00111 
00112 typedef struct timespec cfs_fs_time_t;
00113 
00114 static inline void cfs_fs_time_usec(cfs_fs_time_t *t, struct timeval *v)
00115 {
00116         v->tv_sec  = t->tv_sec;
00117         v->tv_usec = t->tv_nsec / 1000;
00118 }
00119 
00120 static inline void cfs_fs_time_nsec(cfs_fs_time_t *t, struct timespec *s)
00121 {
00122         *s = *t;
00123 }
00124 
00125 /*
00126  * internal helper function used by cfs_fs_time_before*()
00127  */
00128 static inline unsigned long long __cfs_fs_time_flat(cfs_fs_time_t *t)
00129 {
00130         return (unsigned long long)t->tv_sec * NSEC_PER_SEC + t->tv_nsec;
00131 }
00132 
00133 
00134 /*
00135  * Generic kernel stuff
00136  */
00137 
00138 typedef unsigned long cfs_time_t;      /* jiffies */
00139 typedef long cfs_duration_t;
00140 typedef cycles_t cfs_cycles_t;
00141 
00142 static inline int cfs_time_before(cfs_time_t t1, cfs_time_t t2)
00143 {
00144         return time_before(t1, t2);
00145 }
00146 
00147 static inline int cfs_time_beforeq(cfs_time_t t1, cfs_time_t t2)
00148 {
00149         return time_before_eq(t1, t2);
00150 }
00151 
00152 static inline cfs_time_t cfs_time_current(void)
00153 {
00154         return jiffies;
00155 }
00156 
00157 static inline time_t cfs_time_current_sec(void)
00158 {
00159         return get_seconds();
00160 }
00161 
00162 static inline void cfs_fs_time_current(cfs_fs_time_t *t)
00163 {
00164         *t = CURRENT_TIME;
00165 }
00166 
00167 static inline time_t cfs_fs_time_sec(cfs_fs_time_t *t)
00168 {
00169         return t->tv_sec;
00170 }
00171 
00172 static inline int cfs_fs_time_before(cfs_fs_time_t *t1, cfs_fs_time_t *t2)
00173 {
00174         return __cfs_fs_time_flat(t1) <  __cfs_fs_time_flat(t2);
00175 }
00176 
00177 static inline int cfs_fs_time_beforeq(cfs_fs_time_t *t1, cfs_fs_time_t *t2)
00178 {
00179         return __cfs_fs_time_flat(t1) <= __cfs_fs_time_flat(t2);
00180 }
00181 
00182 static inline cfs_duration_t cfs_time_seconds(int seconds)
00183 {
00184 
00185         return ((cfs_duration_t)seconds) * msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00186 }
00187 
00188 static inline time_t cfs_duration_sec(cfs_duration_t d)
00189 {
00190 
00191         return d / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00192 }
00193 
00194 static inline void cfs_duration_usec(cfs_duration_t d, struct timeval *s)
00195 {
00196 #if (BITS_PER_LONG == 32)
00197         if (msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC) > 4096) {
00198                 __u64 t;
00199 
00200                 s->tv_sec = d / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00201                 t = (d - (cfs_duration_t)s->tv_sec *
00202                      msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)) * USEC_PER_SEC;
00203                 do_div(t, msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC));
00204                 s->tv_usec = t;
00205         } else {
00206                 s->tv_sec = d / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00207                 s->tv_usec = ((d - (cfs_duration_t)s->tv_sec *
00208                                msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)) *
00209                                USEC_PER_SEC) / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00210         }
00211 #else
00212         s->tv_sec = d / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00213         s->tv_usec = ((d - (cfs_duration_t)s->tv_sec *
00214                        msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)) *
00215                        USEC_PER_SEC) / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00216 #endif
00217 }
00218 
00219 static inline void cfs_duration_nsec(cfs_duration_t d, struct timespec *s)
00220 {
00221 #if (BITS_PER_LONG == 32)
00222         __u64 t;
00223 
00224         s->tv_sec = d / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00225         t = (d - s->tv_sec * msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)) * NSEC_PER_SEC;
00226         do_div(t, msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC));
00227         s->tv_nsec = t;
00228 #else
00229         s->tv_sec = d / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00230         s->tv_nsec = ((d - s->tv_sec * msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)) *
00231                       NSEC_PER_SEC) / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00232 #endif
00233 }
00234 
00235 #define cfs_time_current_64 get_jiffies_64
00236 
00237 static inline __u64 cfs_time_add_64(__u64 t, __u64 d)
00238 {
00239         return t + d;
00240 }
00241 
00242 static inline __u64 cfs_time_shift_64(int seconds)
00243 {
00244         return cfs_time_add_64(cfs_time_current_64(),
00245                                cfs_time_seconds(seconds));
00246 }
00247 
00248 static inline int cfs_time_before_64(__u64 t1, __u64 t2)
00249 {
00250         return (__s64)t2 - (__s64)t1 > 0;
00251 }
00252 
00253 static inline int cfs_time_beforeq_64(__u64 t1, __u64 t2)
00254 {
00255         return (__s64)t2 - (__s64)t1 >= 0;
00256 }
00257 
00258 
00259 /*
00260  * One jiffy
00261  */
00262 #define CFS_TIME_T              "%lu"
00263 #define CFS_DURATION_T          "%ld"
00264 
00265 
00266 #endif /* __LIBCFS_LINUX_LINUX_TIME_H__ */
